title: Psalms Chapter 34 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Psalms chapter 34 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Psalms Chapter 34 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Psalms Chapter 34.

questions.question: Who is the Psalm of Psalms 34 attributed to?
questions.correctAnswer: David
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:1 states, 'A Psalm of David.'

questions.question: What did David say he would do at all times according to Psalms 34:1?
questions.correctAnswer: Bless the LORD
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:1 says, 'I will bless the LORD at all times.'

questions.question: According to Psalms 34:4, what did the LORD do when David sought Him?
options: He heard him and delivered him from all his fears
questions.correctAnswer: He heard him and delivered him from all his fears
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:4 states, 'I sought the LORD, and he heard me, and delivered me from all my fears.'

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Psalms 34:8: 'O taste and see that the LORD is ____.'
questions.correctAnswer: good
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:8 says, 'O taste and see that the LORD is good.'

questions.question: Who encampeth round about them that fear the LORD, according to Psalms 34:7?
questions.correctAnswer: The angel of the LORD
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:7 states, 'The angel of the LORD encampeth round about them that fear him.'

questions.question: True or False: According to Psalms 34:6, the LORD saved the poor man out of all his troubles.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:6 says, 'This poor man cried, and the LORD heard him, and saved him out of all his troubles.'

questions.question: What shall not want any good thing according to Psalms 34:10?
questions.correctAnswer: They that seek the LORD
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:10 says, 'but they that seek the LORD shall not want any good thing.'

questions.question: According to Psalms 34:12, what kind of man desires life and loves many days?
questions.correctAnswer: One that may see good
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:12 asks, 'What man is he that desireth life, and loveth many days, that he may see good?'

questions.question: According to Psalms 34:13, what should one keep from evil?
questions.correctAnswer: Thy tongue
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:13 says, 'Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips from speaking guile.'

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 34:14 instructs to depart from evil and do good, seek peace and pursue it.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:14 states, 'Depart from evil, and do good; seek peace, and pursue it.'

questions.question: Who are the eyes of the LORD upon according to Psalms 34:15?
questions.correctAnswer: The righteous
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:15 says, 'The eyes of the LORD are upon the righteous.'

questions.question: According to Psalms 34:18, the LORD is near to whom?
options: Them that are of a broken heart
questions.correctAnswer: Them that are of a broken heart
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:18 states, 'The LORD is nigh unto them that are of a broken heart.'

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 34:20 says not one of the righteous man's bones is broken.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:20 says, 'He keepeth all his bones: not one of them is broken.'

questions.question: According to Psalms 34:21, who shall be desolate?
questions.correctAnswer: They that hate the righteous
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:21 states, 'they that hate the righteous shall be desolate.'

questions.question: What does the LORD do for the soul of His servants according to Psalms 34:22?
questions.correctAnswer: Redeemeth
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:22 says, 'The LORD redeemeth the soul of his servants.'

medium.title: Psalms Chapter 34 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Psalms Chapter 34 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is going through a trial and asks you for counsel. Based on Psalms 34, what biblical truth would you share about God's care in difficult times?
options: God hears their cries and delivers them from troubles
They must solve their problems alone
Trials mean God has abandoned them
Trusting in God will bring immediate wealth
questions.correctAnswer: God hears their cries and delivers them from troubles
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:17 says 'The righteous cry, and the LORD heareth, and delivereth them out of all their troubles.' This shows God’s attentive care and deliverance for those who trust in Him, supported by verses 6, 7, and 19.

questions.question: How does Psalms 34 teach us about humility and boasting in the Lord?
options: The humble shall hear and be glad when the soul boasts in the LORD
Humility is not important in faith
We should boast about our personal achievements
questions.correctAnswer: The humble shall hear and be glad when the soul boasts in the LORD
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:2 says 'My soul shall make her boast in the LORD: the humble shall hear thereof, and be glad.' This highlights that boasting in God brings joy to the humble, emphasizing humility and reliance on God rather than self.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with fear. Based on Psalms 34, what practical spiritual discipline should you encourage?
options: Seek the LORD because He hears and delivers from fear
Avoid prayer and face fear alone
Trust only in your own strength
Ignore the fear and hope it goes away
questions.correctAnswer: Seek the LORD because He hears and delivers from fear
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:4 states 'I sought the LORD, and he heard me, and delivered me from all my fears.' Seeking God in prayer is shown as the way to overcome fear, supported by verses 6 and 7 about God's protective care.

questions.question: What does Psalms 34 teach about integrity in speech?
options: Keep your tongue from evil and lips from speaking guile
Speak whatever comes to mind without filter
Silence is always better than speaking
questions.correctAnswer: Keep your tongue from evil and lips from speaking guile
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:13 commands to 'Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips from speaking guile.' This promotes honesty and integrity in speech as a key part of righteous living, supported by verses 14 and 21 about doing good and the fate of the wicked.

questions.question: A parent wants to teach their children the fear of the LORD. According to Psalms 34, what is the best approach?
options: Invite children to listen and learn about the fear of the LORD
Avoid teaching about fear of God
Teach children only rules without love
questions.correctAnswer: Invite children to listen and learn about the fear of the LORD
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:11 says 'Come, ye children, hearken unto me: I will teach you the fear of the LORD.' This encourages teaching with invitation and explanation, fostering understanding and reverence, supported by verses 9 and 12 about fearing the LORD.

questions.question: How does Psalms 34 illustrate God's protection for those who fear Him?
options: The angel of the LORD encampeth round about them and delivereth them
questions.correctAnswer: The angel of the LORD encampeth round about them and delivereth them
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:7 states 'The angel of the LORD encampeth round about them that fear him, and delivereth them.' This verse shows divine protection surrounding believers who fear God, supported by verses 15 and 18 about God's attentive care.

questions.question: What practical advice does Psalms 34 give about pursuing peace and goodness in everyday life?
options: Depart from evil, do good, seek peace, and pursue it
questions.correctAnswer: Depart from evil, do good, seek peace, and pursue it
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:14 instructs 'Depart from evil, and do good; seek peace, and pursue it.' This sets a clear guideline for ethical living and active pursuit of peace, which aligns with verses 13 and 21 about integrity and justice.

questions.question: True or False: According to Psalms 34, those who seek the LORD will lack no good thing.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:10 says 'but they that seek the LORD shall not want any good thing.' This affirms God's provision for those who earnestly seek Him, supported by verses 9 and 22 about the blessings of fearing and trusting the LORD.

questions.question: What does Psalms 34 say about God's attitude toward the wicked and those who hate the righteous?
options: Evil shall slay the wicked; those who hate the righteous shall be desolate
God will bless the wicked if they repent
questions.correctAnswer: Evil shall slay the wicked; those who hate the righteous shall be desolate
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:21 states 'Evil shall slay the wicked: and they that hate the righteous shall be desolate.' This shows God’s justice toward the wicked, supported by verses 16 and 19 about God's opposition to evil and deliverance of the righteous.

questions.question: A believer feels brokenhearted and discouraged. Based on Psalms 34, what encouragement can you offer about God's nearness?
options: The LORD is near to the brokenhearted and saves the contrite in spirit
God is distant when you feel broken
Only strong people receive God's help
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD is near to the brokenhearted and saves the contrite in spirit
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:18 says 'The LORD is nigh unto them that are of a broken heart; and saveth such as be of a contrite spirit.' This verse offers comfort and hope to those in distress, supported by verses 6 and 17 about God's attentive care.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 34 teaches that no bone of the righteous will be broken.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:20 says 'He keepeth all his bones: not one of them is broken.' This is often understood as symbolic of God's protection and care for the righteous, supported by verses 7 and 19.

questions.question: Based on Psalms 34, how should a believer respond in prayer when facing troubles?
options: Cry out to the LORD because He hears and saves
Ignore God and rely on self
questions.correctAnswer: Cry out to the LORD because He hears and saves
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:6 states 'This poor man cried, and the LORD heard him, and saved him out of all his troubles.' This encourages believers to pray earnestly, supported by verses 4, 17, and 22 about God's attentive ear and deliverance.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'O taste and see that the LORD is _____: blessed is the man that trusteth in him.'
questions.correctAnswer: good
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:8 says 'O taste and see that the LORD is good: blessed is the man that trusteth in him.' This verse highlights the experiential knowledge of God's goodness as foundational for trust.

questions.question: How does Psalms 34 suggest believers should live to enjoy long life and goodness?
options: Keep your tongue from evil and lips from speaking guile
Live selfishly without regard for others
questions.correctAnswer: Keep your tongue from evil and lips from speaking guile
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:12-13 asks who desires life and instructs to keep the tongue from evil and lips from guile, indicating integrity and righteousness as keys to a good life, supported by verses 14 and 15.

questions.question: What does Psalms 34 teach about the blessings for those who fear the LORD?
options: There is no want to them that fear him
They will be popular among men
questions.correctAnswer: There is no want to them that fear him
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:9 says 'for there is no want to them that fear him.' This means God provides for those who reverence Him, supported by verses 10 and 22 about God’s provision and redemption.

hard.title: Psalms Chapter 34 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Psalms Chapter 34.

questions.question: In Psalms 34:7, what role does the angel of the LORD play for those who fear Him?
options: He encampeth round about them and delivereth them
He grants them riches and honor
questions.correctAnswer: He encampeth round about them and delivereth them
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:7 explicitly states that the angel of the LORD encampeth round about them that fear him, and delivereth them, signifying divine protection for the faithful.

questions.question: The phrase 'O taste and see that the LORD is good' in Psalms 34:8 is an example of which literary device?
questions.correctAnswer: Imperative invitation
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:8 uses an imperative invitation urging the reader to experience God's goodness firsthand, engaging the senses metaphorically to encourage trust.

questions.question: According to Psalms 34:20, what is said about the bones of the righteous?
options: Not one of them is broken
questions.correctAnswer: Not one of them is broken
questions.explanation: Verse 20 highlights divine protection over the righteous, emphasizing no bones are broken, which echoes the prophecy about the Messiah in John 19:36.

questions.question: What is the promised outcome for those who seek the LORD according to Psalms 34:10?
options: They shall not want any good thing
They will suffer hunger like young lions
They will be wealthy beyond measure
They will be feared by their enemies
questions.correctAnswer: They shall not want any good thing
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:10 contrasts the hunger of young lions with the provision given to those who seek the LORD, promising that they will lack no good thing.

questions.question: Which theme in Psalms 34:18 is echoed in Isaiah 61:1 regarding God's care for the brokenhearted?
options: The LORD is nigh unto them that are of a broken heart
The LORD judges the wicked swiftly
The LORD grants wealth and honor
The LORD commands peace on earth
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD is nigh unto them that are of a broken heart
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:18 expresses God's nearness to the brokenhearted, a theme also central in Isaiah 61:1 where the Spirit of the Lord brings comfort to the afflicted.

questions.question: What is the significance of the Hebrew word translated as 'contrite spirit' in Psalms 34:18?
options: It implies a humble and repentant heart
It means a joyful and exuberant mind
It denotes a strong and unyielding will
It refers to a wise and discerning soul
questions.correctAnswer: It implies a humble and repentant heart
questions.explanation: The Hebrew term for 'contrite' (נִשְׁבָּר, nishbar) in Psalms 34:18 signifies brokenness and humility before God, essential for receiving His salvation.

questions.question: In Psalms 34:4, what was David’s experience when he sought the LORD?
options: The LORD heard him and delivered him from all his fears
The LORD delayed and tested his faith
The LORD gave him wealth and power immediately
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD heard him and delivered him from all his fears
questions.explanation: Verse 4 recounts David’s personal testimony that God responded to his seeking by delivering him from fears, highlighting divine responsiveness.

questions.question: How does Psalms 34:15-16 illustrate a chiasm in its structure regarding God's relationship with the righteous and the wicked?
options: God’s eyes and ears are attentive to the righteous, but His face is against evildoers
God blesses both the righteous and the wicked equally
God is indifferent to human actions
God favors the wealthy over the poor
questions.correctAnswer: God’s eyes and ears are attentive to the righteous, but His face is against evildoers
questions.explanation: Verses 15 and 16 form a chiasm contrasting God's care for the righteous with His judgment against evildoers, emphasizing divine justice through parallelism.

questions.question: What is the intended audience of the exhortation in Psalms 34:11, and what is the teaching focus?
options: Children; teaching them the fear of the LORD
Kings; teaching them to be just
questions.correctAnswer: Children; teaching them the fear of the LORD
questions.explanation: Verse 11 addresses 'children' symbolically to instruct the next generation in reverence for God, which is foundational for wisdom and righteous living.

questions.question: According to Psalms 34:21, what is the fate of those who hate the righteous?
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be desolate
questions.explanation: The verse pronounces desolation on those who hate the righteous, reflecting the theme of divine justice common in wisdom literature.

questions.question: How does Psalms 34:22 connect with the theme of redemption in the broader biblical narrative?
options: The LORD redeemeth the soul of his servants, ensuring none who trust in Him are desolate
Redemption is solely physical, not spiritual
Redemption is achieved by human effort alone
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD redeemeth the soul of his servants, ensuring none who trust in Him are desolate
questions.explanation: Verse 22 affirms God's redemptive power over the soul, a key theme echoed in the New Testament's portrayal of salvation through Christ.

questions.question: What parallelism is demonstrated in Psalms 34:14 with the instructions given?
options: Depart from evil and do good; seek peace and pursue it
Love your neighbor and hate your enemy
questions.correctAnswer: Depart from evil and do good; seek peace and pursue it
questions.explanation: This verse exhibits synonymous parallelism by pairing negative commands with positive ones, reinforcing ethical behavior through balanced instruction.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 34:6 states that the LORD ignored the cry of the poor man in his troubles.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:6 clearly states that the poor man cried, and the LORD heard him and saved him from all his troubles, showing God's attentiveness.

questions.question: Which of the following best expresses the Hebrew concept of 'fear of the LORD' as used in Psalms 34:9 and 11?
options: Reverence and awe that leads to obedience
questions.correctAnswer: Reverence and awe that leads to obedience
questions.explanation: The Hebrew term 'yirah' implies reverence and awe toward God, which motivates faithful living, as expressed in these verses.

questions.question: According to Psalms 34:1, what was the historical context of this Psalm involving David?
options: David changed his behavior before Abimelech, who then drove him away
David was crowned king over Israel
David built the temple in Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: David changed his behavior before Abimelech, who then drove him away
questions.explanation: The superscription in Psalms 34:1 references a specific incident where David feigned madness before Abimelech, resulting in his departure.

theological.title: Psalms Chapter 34 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Psalms Chapter 34 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Psalms 34, what is the proper response of the soul toward the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: To boast in the LORD
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:2 states 'My soul shall make her boast in the LORD.' This reflects the biblical theme of rejoicing and glorying in God alone, consistent with Romans 5:11, Jeremiah 9:23, 1 Corinthians 1:31, and Philippians 3:3 which emphasize boasting in the Lord rather than worldly things.

questions.question: What divine protection is promised to those who fear the LORD?
options: The angel of the LORD encamps around them
questions.correctAnswer: The angel of the LORD encamps around them
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:7 declares that 'The angel of the LORD encampeth round about them that fear him, and delivereth them.' This promise of angelic protection aligns with Exodus 23:20, Psalm 91:11, Hebrews 1:14, and 2 Kings 6:17, showing God's care and protection over His people.

questions.question: What is the outcome for those who look unto the LORD according to Psalms 34?
options: They are lightened and their faces are not ashamed
They will conquer their enemies without fail
questions.correctAnswer: They are lightened and their faces are not ashamed
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:5 states that those who look unto Him 'were lightened: and their faces were not ashamed.' This reflects God's grace and vindication, paralleling Isaiah 25:8, John 1:5, Romans 8:1, and 1 Peter 2:6 where God's favor results in confidence and no shame.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'O taste and see that the LORD is ____. Blessed is the man that trusteth in him.'
questions.correctAnswer: good
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:8 invites believers to 'taste and see that the LORD is good,' emphasizing God's benevolent nature and the blessing of trusting Him. This is echoed in Exodus 33:19, Nahum 1:7, James 1:17, and John 10:11, affirming God's goodness as central to salvation.

questions.question: What does Psalms 34 teach about the LORD's response to the cries of the righteous?
options: The LORD hears and delivers them from all troubles
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD hears and delivers them from all troubles
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:17 emphasizes that 'The righteous cry, and the LORD heareth, and delivereth them out of all their troubles.' This is consistent with Psalm 107:6, Isaiah 41:10, Matthew 7:7, and 2 Corinthians 1:10 which affirm God's attentive deliverance of His people.

questions.question: Which characteristic is highlighted as necessary to receive God's deliverance in Psalms 34?
questions.correctAnswer: Fear of the LORD
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:9 commands 'O fear the LORD, ye his saints: for there is no want to them that fear him.' Fear of the LORD, meaning reverential awe and obedience, is foundational for experiencing God's provision and salvation, as affirmed in Proverbs 1:7, Ecclesiastes 12:13, Acts 9:31, and Hebrews 12:28.

questions.question: According to Psalms 34, what is the result for those who seek the LORD?
options: They shall not want any good thing
questions.correctAnswer: They shall not want any good thing
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:10 assures that 'they that seek the LORD shall not want any good thing.' This promise aligns with Matthew 6:33, Philippians 4:19, Psalm 23:1, and Romans 8:32, highlighting God's faithful provision for those who earnestly seek Him.

questions.question: What ethical instructions are given in Psalms 34 regarding speech?
options: Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips from speaking guile
questions.correctAnswer: Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips from speaking guile
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:13 instructs to 'Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips from speaking guile,' teaching purity and truthfulness in speech. This is consistent with Ephesians 4:29, James 3:5-10, Proverbs 15:4, and Colossians 4:6 which emphasize wholesome and honest communication.

questions.question: What does Psalms 34 say about the LORD's attitude toward evildoers?
options: The face of the LORD is against them to cut off their remembrance from the earth
questions.correctAnswer: The face of the LORD is against them to cut off their remembrance from the earth
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:16 states 'The face of the LORD is against them that do evil, to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.' This reflects God's righteous judgment against sin, as seen in Psalm 1:6, Proverbs 3:33, Romans 1:18, and Revelation 20:14.

questions.question: What comfort does Psalms 34 offer to those with a broken heart and contrite spirit?
options: The LORD is near and saves them
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD is near and saves them
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:18 assures 'The LORD is nigh unto them that are of a broken heart; and saveth such as be of a contrite spirit.' This comfort is echoed in Isaiah 57:15, Matthew 5:4, Psalm 147:3, and 2 Corinthians 7:10, highlighting God's compassionate presence with the humble and repentant.

questions.question: How does Psalms 34 describe the afflictions of the righteous and God's response?
options: Many afflictions but the LORD delivers them all
questions.correctAnswer: Many afflictions but the LORD delivers them all
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:19 says 'Many are the afflictions of the righteous: but the LORD delivereth him out of them all.' This truth is consistent with Job 5:19, Romans 8:28, 2 Timothy 4:18, and Psalm 23:4 demonstrating God's faithfulness in deliverance amid suffering.

questions.question: Which statement best summarizes the LORD's care for the righteous as depicted in Psalms 34?
options: He keeps all their bones; not one of them is broken
He lets them suffer without protection
He removes them from the earth quickly
questions.correctAnswer: He keeps all their bones; not one of them is broken
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:20 states 'He keepeth all his bones: not one of them is broken,' symbolizing divine preservation and care. This theme is mirrored in John 19:36, Psalm 41:8, Exodus 12:46, and Isaiah 53:5 where God's protection and fulfillment of prophecy are highlighted.

questions.question: Who does Psalms 34 say will be desolate as a result of hating the righteous?
questions.correctAnswer: Those who hate the righteous
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:21 warns 'Evil shall slay the wicked: and they that hate the righteous shall be desolate.' This principle of judgment against the wicked is reaffirmed in Proverbs 24:19, Matthew 5:11, Psalm 37:12-15, and Revelation 21:8.

questions.question: What ultimate assurance does Psalms 34 offer to those who trust in the LORD?
options: The LORD redeems their soul and they shall not be desolate
They will be exempt from death
They will be rulers over nations
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD redeems their soul and they shall not be desolate
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:22 promises 'The LORD redeemeth the soul of his servants: and none of them that trust in him shall be desolate.' This assurance of redemption is consistent with Isaiah 44:22, Ephesians 1:7, Psalm 103:4, and 1 Peter 1:18-19 highlighting salvation through God's redeeming work.

questions.question: What does Psalms 34 teach about seeking peace according to the ethical exhortations?
options: Depart from evil, do good, seek peace, and pursue it
questions.correctAnswer: Depart from evil, do good, seek peace, and pursue it
questions.explanation: Psalms 34:14 instructs believers to 'Depart from evil, and do good; seek peace, and pursue it.' This aligns with Romans 12:18, Hebrews 12:14, Matthew 5:9, and James 3:18 which emphasize active pursuit of righteousness and peace as marks of godly living.
